CONJUGATES: more inefficient | most inefficient | inefficiently (adv) | inefficiency (n)
ETYMOLOGY: From Medieval Latin inefficentem (nominative inefficens), from in- (not) + efficentem (efficient), ultimately related to Latin efficere ('to effect, carry out').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not achieving maximum productivity; failing to make the best use of time, energy, or resources.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 效率低的；无效率的；未能充分利用时间、精力或资源。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The current bureaucratic process is highly inefficient and needs complete reorganization.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 目前的官僚程序效率非常低，需要彻底重组。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Lacking the ability or skill to perform a task efficiently.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （指人）缺乏效率的；不能高效地完成任务的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Despite his good intentions, the new intern was rather inefficient at managing his workload.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 尽管他意图良好，但这位新实习生在管理工作量方面效率相当低下。
